newsitem.title: USA: Ralcorp Q1 consumer foods sales down.
newsitem.headline: Ralcorp Q1 consumer foods sales down.

text.p: Ralcorp Holdings Inc on Friday said its consumer foods sales dipped 1.6 percent to $263.7 million in the fiscal first quarter ended December 31, primarily because declining sales of branded and private-label cereals.
Total sales in the quarter compared with $267.9 million in the same period a year earlier.
Weakness in cereals was partially offset by a strong performance from Ralcorp Chex Snack Mix product line and volume gains on Bremner private label crackers and cookies, and Beech-Nut baby food.
Consumer foods' operating profit, excluding charges, rose to $36.2 million from $33.2 million, primarily because of the improvement by Chex Snack Mix.

The performance by Chex was partially offset by higher advertising and promotion spending and the decline in cereals. Baby food operating profit was little changed as volume increases were offset by higher cost of goods.

Earlier, Ralcorp reported that its first-quarter earnings slipped to $0.40 a share from $0.44, including charges. With the charges excluded, Ralcorp's first-quarter net income rose to $0.49 a share from $0.46.

Ralcorp will hold a special shareholders meeting on January 31 to vote on a proposed merger of its branded ceral and snack operations with General Mills Inc and the spin-off to shareholders of the remaining Ralcorp operations.
Shareholders will receive one share of new Ralcorp stock for every existing share held and an appropriate number of General Mills shares.
